name: Special Topics in Health: Inequality, Inequity, and Health
description: An examination of a current topic in inequality, inequity, marginalization, social exclusion, and health outcomes. Topics may include: health and homelessness, poverty and sexual health, political conflict and refugee health. The course will provide students with relevant information about social context and health policy, but will focus on the physical and mental health impacts of various forms of inequity.
prerequisites: Completion of at least 6.0 credits including 2.0 credits at the C-level in HLT courses from the requirements of the Major/Major Co-op programs in Health Studies; and permission of the instructor.
